docs.lead_paragraph: The recession has increased the nation's health care bills, forcing Americans to spend 5.7 percent more for health services and drugs in 2009 than they spent in 2008, according to new projections in a report by the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

headline.main: Health Care's Share of U.S. Economy Rose at Record Rate

docs.abstract: Spending on health care represented 17.3 percent of G.D.P. in 2009, a record 1.1 percent increase over 2008.
docs.snippet: Spending on health care represented 17.3 percent of G.D.P. in 2009, a record 1.1 percent increase over 2008.

docs.lead_paragraph: The evangelical group, Focus on the Family, has purchased an ad for the Super Bowl that is expected to contain an anti-abortion message.

headline.seo: An Advocacy Ad Stirs a National Debate
headline.main: An Advocacy Ad Stirs a National Debate
headline.print_headline: An Advocacy Ad Stirs a National Debate

docs.snippet: The evangelical group, Focus on the Family, has purchased an ad for the Super Bowl that is expected to contain an anti-abortion message.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Leslie Baumann’s comments in the media about an antiwrinkle drug violated restrictions on drug promotion, the agency said, in what is believed to be the first time an individual researcher was warned.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Warns Dr. Leslie Baumann About Promoting Dysport
headline.main: F.D.A. Aims at Doctors’ Drug Pitches
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Aims At Doctors’ Drug Pitches

docs.snippet: Dr. Leslie Baumann’s comments in the media about an antiwrinkle drug violated restrictions on drug promotion, the agency said, in what is believed to be the first time an individual researcher was warned.
